current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit aliens who
			 are not lawfully present in the United States from being eligible for
			 postsecondary education benefits that are not available to
			 all citizens and nationals of the United States.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 505 of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996/s:505

header.#text: Prohibition of preferential treatment for illegal aliens

Ineligibility for aliens not lawfully present in the United States to receive preferential
			 postsecondary education benefits

text.#text:
An alien who is not lawfully present in the United States shall not be eligible for any
			 postsecondary education benefit
			 unless every
			 citizen and national of the United States is eligible to receive such a
			 benefit (in no less an amount, duration, and scope).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may petition the district court of the United States in
			 which such institution is located to enforce  the restriction described in
			 such subsection  by commencing a civil action, on his or her own behalf,
			 in such court against any State official that oversees such institution.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996/s:505/ss:a

text.#text:
Any citizen or national of the United States who is enrolled at a postsecondary educational
			 institution in the United States that is alleged to have violated

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
proves by a preponderance of the
			 evidence that the postsecondary educational institution in which the
			 plaintiff was enrolled  violated
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996/s:505/ss:b/p:1
Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996/s:505/ss:a

text.#text: If the plaintiff in a civil action commenced under

provide all appropriate relief to the plaintiff, including damages equal to the monetary value of
			 any benefit provided to an alien who is not lawfully present in the United
			 States that was denied to the plaintiff; and
award attorneys' fees and court costs to the plaintiff.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1990 IS: To prohibit aliens who are not lawfully present in the United States from being eligible for postsecondary education benefits that are not available to all citizens and nationals of the United States.
